lines.text: My uncle used to say that we like people for their qualities but we love them for their defects.

[while stitching up Hellboy's forearm]
How long did he touch you?
I don't know? About 5 seconds?

[pulls three eggs out of his forearm]
Touched you five seconds, laid three eggs.
Didn't even buy me a drink.
his appearance]
I'll always look this good.
[Liz laughs]
I'll never give up on you... ever.
I like that.
Good.
[Hellboy grabs Sammael's tongue]
Second date, no tongue!
In the dark I heard your voice, what did you say?
I said, "Hey, you, on the other side - let her go. Because for her I will cross over, and then you'll be sorry!"
the Occult Wars finally come to an end with the death of Adolf Hitler.
1945, you mean. Hitler died in '45.

[amused]
Did he now?
Hey Myers, you're a talker. What's a good word, a solid word for "need"?
Well, "need" is a good, solid word.
Nah. Too needy.

[carrying the torso of a re-animated corpse over his shoulder]
How you doing back there, Ivan?

[in Russian]
If I still had legs, I'd kick your ass!

[to agent]
Could you hold this guy for a while? He is so negative.
Are you okay?
[manning nods weakly. Hellboy brings out a cigar and fires up his Zippo]
You'd better stay here. I'll find a way out. We'll come back for you.
You call that thing a cigar?
Yup.
You never, ever light a cigar that way.

[he digs out one of his fine cigars, cuts it and hands it to Hellboy]
Use a wooden match. It preserves the flavor.

[he lights it for him and Hellboy grins]
Thank you.

[smiles]
My job.
[about his Rubik's Cube]
Listen, I'm not much of a problem solver. Three decades... and I've only completed two sides.

[about Sammael]
Harbinger of Pestilence, Seed of Destr...
Cut to the end, will ya? How do I kill it?
Hmm, doesn't say.
Remind me why I do this again.
Rotten eggs and the safety of mankind.
Ah!
Look, Sammy, I'm not a very good shot...
[holds up his huge revolver]
...but the Samaritan here uses really big bullets.
[Broom opens a box full of rosaries]
Your men, they'll need these.

[sniggers]
Are you a Catholic?
Yes, among other things. But that's hardly the point.

[locks and loads a pistol]
Here. You'll need one of these.

[hears the alarm in his room, to Myers]
Hey. Hey. Hey. They're playing our song.
[spying on Liz and Myers]
She took his picture. DAMN. She took his picture. She took his picture.
[Hellboy is going back to confront Behemoth]
Are you going to be... okay? Alone?
How big can it be?
[a tentacle grabs Hellboy and pulls him back]
Red, white, whatever. Guys are all the same.
He doesn't want me with him. I know that much. He respects Clay, not me.
You're doing fine.
No, I'm not. Look, I'm really sorry, but I'm not your guy.
I'm dying, Agent Myers. Like any father, I worry about him.
[pauses]
In medieval stories, there is often a young knight who is inexperienced, but pure of heart.
Oh, come on. I am not pure of heart.
Yes, you are.
Rasputin is back for him. What I'm asking of you is to have the courage to stand by him when I am gone. He was born a demon; we can't change that. But you will help him, in essence, to become a man.
[holding his stone hand up to a moving car]
Red means stop!
[punches the car into the air]

[after probing the sealed door]
Behind this door, a dark entity. Evil, ancient and hungry.

[sighs]
Oh, well. Let me go in and say hi.
Just go down there and tell her how you feel.
[Hellboy is silent]
My mom always says...
It's not... it's not that easy. Plus, you're nine. You're not old enough to be giving me advice.
[last lines]

"What makes a man a man?" a friend of mine once wondered. Is it his origins? The way he comes to life? I don't think so. It's the choices he makes. Not how he starts things, but how he decides to end them.
Let me tell you - let me tell you something about the Bureau of...
Paranormal Research and Defense.
there is no such thing.
[cut to BPRD headquarters in New Jersey]
[communicating on radio]
Sparky to Big Red...
Sparky? Who came up with that? Myers?
He disclosed to me the child's true name. Would you like to know it?
I already know what to call him. I call him "son".
[about to die, to Grigori]
Hell will hold no surprises for us.
I'm fireproof, you're not.
[repeated line]
Aw, crap.
I'm gonna be sore in the mornin'!
You killed my father, your ass is mine!

[as Hellboy walks away from Sammael's corpse]
Red, you need to hear the rest of the information.
Nah, he's taken care of.
No, listen to this. Sammael, the Desolate One, Lord of the Shadows, Son of Nergal...
[Hellboy starts to make "blah blah" motions with his hand]
...hound of resurrection.

[stops]
See, I don't like that.
What? Hound of resurrection?

[turns around; Sammael is gone]
Mmm.
Look at the size of that whammer!
Outside. I could be outside.
You mean, outside with her.
Don't get psychic with me, fella.
Nothing psychic about it. You're easy.
How am I gonna get a girl? I drive around in a garbage truck.
Liz left us, Red. Take the hint.

[picks up his gun]
We don't take hints.
Open wide!
[breaks Sammael's lower jaw]
A 16-century statue was destroyed. Saint Dionysius the Areopagite.
Who wards off demons.
The statue, however, was hollow.
A reliquary?
A prison. The Vatican thought its occupant dangerous enough to include it on the list of Avignon, of which, by the way, we hold a copy.
[Hellboy holds up a speed-loader of giant glass bullets]
Perfect job for these babies. Made 'em myself. Holy water, clover leaf, silver shavings, white oak... the works.
[in a large cemetery, searching for Rasputin's mausoleum]
Where are you going?
To ask for directions.
[opens an amulet]
Come on, find me a talker...
I hate those comic books. They never get the eyes right.
So, how many escapes, this year alone? Five!
Tom, he's our guest, not a prisoner!
Yeah, well, your guest happens to be six-foot five, bright red, has a tail, and is government funded.
Hey, Sparky... tell everyone to turn on their locator belts if anyone sees anything.
Are you sure about this?
On a scale of one to ten, two.

[two government agents have died under Hellboy's command and Manning is displeased]
You know what my problem with you is? You're reckless. Those two men trusted you to lead them as a team. Where were you?
I knew those men better than you did.
Ah, I see. That makes it all right then.
No, it doesn't make it all right, but I stopped that thing, didn't I?
Yeah, that's what you do. That's why we need you. You have an insight. You know monsters.
What are you trying to say?
you.

[sighs and acts natural]
Manning, I wish I could be more gracious, but...
[furiously pulls a machine from off the floor, lifts it and heaves it in Manning's direction]
There's a big, red man down there.
That's fine, darling. Santa's not here for another month.
Not Santa.
So there we were, an unwanted child and an unready father. The name we gave him was not, perhaps, an appropriate one. But we would all call him by it in the years to come. That name, was Hellboy.
Open the final lock.
[Hellboy moves to insert his stone hand into the second lock]
Remember who you are!
[Meyers throws Professor Bruttenholm's rosary at Hellboy. He pauses]
Believe me, I have lived long enough to know! Not a tear will be shed for this world!
You have a choice! Your father gave you that!
No, you don't! There is no choice! Now, open it! DO IT!
[Hellboy tears his horns off]
What have you done?
I CHOSE.
[stabs Rasputin with his horns]
You will never understand what kind of power you have.
I guess I'll have to find some way to live with that.
You're wasting our time, there's nothing on this island but sheep and rocks!
[moments later the soldiers find a large Nazi encampment in the ruins]
They must be here for the sheep.
[examining Kroenen's corpse]

Subject, Karl Ruprecht Kroenen. Born in Munich, 1897. Suffered from a masochistic compulsion commonly known as "surgical addiction". Both eyelids surgically removed, along with his upper and lower lip, making speech impossible. The blood in his veins dried up decades ago. Only dust remains.
[he removes a revolving key from Kroenen's heart]
Four broken vertebrae. A steel rod inserted into his pelvis kept him upright... what horrible will could keep such a creature as this alive?
[Hellboy and Sammael fall through a vent]
YOU DAMNED MONSTER!
[Hellboy punches him]
[Hellboy pummels Sammael]
Hurts, doesn't it? You shouldn't hurt PEOPLE!
[last words]

[in Russian]
I was better off dead!
[as Ilsa pours out salt from the reliquary inside the statue]

Salt, gathered from the tears of a thousand angels, restraining the essence of Sammael, the Hellhound. The Seed of Destruction. This I can promise, Sammael, for every one of you that falls, two shall arise.
So you met the fish guy, right?
Oh, yeah. That was weird.

[unimpressed]
Yeah, right. Well, come on in. Meet the rest of the family.
[first lines]

What is it that makes a man a man? Is it his origins, the way things start? Or is it something else, something harder to describe? For me it all began in 1944, a classified mission off the coast of Scotland. The Nazis were desperate. Combining science and black magic, they intended to upset the balance of the war. I was 28, already a paranormal advisor to President Roosevelt. I could never have suspected that what would transpire that night would not only effect the course of history, but change my life forever.
Didn't I kill you already?
[Hellboy breaks through a wall and sees Liz has returned to the B.P.R.D. with John]
Liz?
Some things never change.
LIZ!
[Liz walks away, leaving John]
You did it buddy! You DID IT!
[John walks away, leaving Hellboy]
Myers? Pop?
[nearby phone rings as Hellboy fights Sammael]
IT'S FOR YOU!
[Hellboy hits Sammuel with the phone]
Mmmmmm nachos.

[to Manning while handling a piece of evidence ungloved]
Don't worry about fingerprints. Never had any.
[as Hellboy tries to board a train in pursuit of a monster, the driver beats him in the head with a fire extinguisher]
OW! HEY! I'm on your side!
Huh! Sure!
[hits Hellboy again]
Did you ever lose track of him?
Well let's see - there was that moment, when I had the train on top of my head...

[in a tank, to Liz]
If there's trouble, all us freaks have is each other. And I'm stuck in here, so look after the big lug for me, will you?
In the absence of light, darkness prevails. There are things that go bump in the night, Agent Myers. Make no mistake about that. And we are the ones who bump back.
Hey, no one goes with him? Jesus.
No. He likes it that way. The whole "lonely hero" thing.

[while Sammael is eating]
What you having? Six library guards, raw, plus belts and boots. Man, you're gonna need some heavy fiber to move that out.
[Clay examines his new hair implants]
This doesn't really look like doll's hair! Be honest, what do you think, Red?
I'm thinking about doing it myself.
[on TV, Manning is confronted with the latest picture of Hellboy]
I have a question. Why is it, in these pictures, pictures of aliens, UFOs, the yeti, Hellboy, why is it they're always out of focus?
[audience laughs]

[to Hellboy, when she realizes that she and Myers are trapped with several Sammaels]
Marco. Marco. Get your big red butt down here!

[referring to stinger from Sammael's tongue on Hellboy's arm]
What is that thing?
Ah crap!
[hands stinger to Myers]
I'll go ask!
[Myers fumbles with stinger and drops it while shuddering]
You've been burned by some kind of organic acid.
I'm lucky that way.

[upon seeing cockroaches leaving the cistern he's about to enter]
We lead a charmed life.
Look at them ugly suckers, Blue. One sheet of glass between us and them.
Story of my life.
Professor... you are very sick.
I don't want Hellboy to know!
I wish you would take better care of yourself. I'm not going to be around for ever, you know.
DAD!
Have you found them yet?
I got 'em right below me. Matter of minutes.
Okay, good. Could you hurry up, because it's a... it's a little spooky in here.

[to John as she ignites her powers]
You should be running.

[after punching through a brick wall]
You guys comin' or what?
[holding a corpse by a noose over his shoulder]
This is Ivan Klimatovich. Say hi, Ivan.

[in Russian]
Go that way, Red Monkey!
What landed you this job, pushing "pamcakes"?
Hey! Stinky!
Mmmm... nachos!
Seal the doors. Red and Blue are coming in.

[after spotting Sammael in railway tunnel]
Waiting for me, chunk-face?
Unique. That is a word you will hear frequently around here.

[as Abe is patching up Hellboy's arm after his first fight with Sammael, Abe accidentally hurts Hellboy]
DAMN! Could you *please* be a little more careful?
Mm-hmm... big baby.
Hey, fish stick. Don't touch anything.
I need to touch it to see.
See what?
Past, future. Whatever this object holds.
[after killing Kroenen, Cpl. Matlin help Broom to his feet. They turn around and discover that Kroenen has vanished]

[shocked]
He's gone.

[calmly]
For now.
